definition: classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: Three surprising things came out of Starr’s testimony.
sentences.chinese: 斯塔尔的证词中有三处令人吃惊。

sentences.english: It’s astonishing what great teachers can do for their students.
sentences.chinese: 优秀教师对自己学生所做的令人吃惊。

sentences.english: “The speed of change, ” wrote Wilcox, “is astonishing.”
sentences.chinese: 威尔科克斯写到，“变化的速度令人吃惊。”

sentences.english: The reasons for the new American austerity are subtler, but not shocking.
sentences.chinese: 美国紧缩新政的原因更为微妙，但并不令人吃惊。

sentences.english: Such single- mindedness is particularly striking given the city's diversity.
sentences.chinese: 考虑到该城的多元性，民众如此专一尤其令人吃惊。

sentences.english: In fact she can bound across a room at a surprisingly break-neck pace.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，她在房间里撒欢乱跑的速度简直令人吃惊。

sentences.english: It's amazing what a good night's sleep can do for a man.
sentences.chinese: 晚上睡一个好觉对健康的作用真令人吃惊。

sentences.english: The length of time required for these types of negotiations always seems mind-boggling.
sentences.chinese: 这一类谈判需要花费的时间似乎总是长得令人吃惊。

sentences.english: Surprisingly, most students don't take advantage of extra-credit .
sentences.chinese: 令人吃惊得是，很多学生没好好利用这点。

sentences.english: The accuracy achieved from this simplerefinement can be astonishing.
sentences.chinese: 这种简单的人工制品的精确度令人吃惊。

sentences.english: It's sur-prising that she can bear up with such an affliction.
sentences.chinese: 她能这样刻苦耐劳是令人吃惊的。

sentences.english: The President's final decision came with stunning suddenness .
sentences.chinese: 总统的最后决定之突然令人吃惊。

sentences.english: It has been a surprise it has not been going like hotcakes.
sentences.chinese: 令人吃惊的是，它却没有那样畅销。

sentences.english: In his first fight against Jermain Taylor, Taylor was surprisingly gun-shy .
sentences.chinese: 在与泰勒的一番战中，泰勒令人吃惊地保守。

sentences.english: His unexpected surprising conceits make people astonished and admired.
sentences.chinese: 他的出人意料的比喻令人吃惊之余深为叹服。

definition: turned out other than expected (idiom); unexpected
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
